commit_message:
Add PermitRootLogin option in sshd_config before leapp.

One of the pre-requisites for leapp tool to be able to upgrade
is the existence of the PermitRootLogin option in the
sshd_config file. It doesn't mind which value it has, it needs
to be set. For that reason, this patch will set the value to
without-password (which is the default for the PermitRootLogin
field).

The selection of the option isn't really relevant, as during
the installation of the openstack services puppet will just
overwrite the sshd_config, therefore this is simply a hack
for leapp to let us upgrade.

Change-Id: Id647896fda6cc3fe7bf5eb5ba2de05111d174092

subject: Unset public_endpoint by default
messages:
[{'account_id': 9816, 'date': '2020-07-22 06:20:25.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 9816, 'date': '2020-07-22 06:34:25.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow-1'}, {'account_id': 9816, 'date': '2020-07-22 12:09:31.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 9816, 'date': '2020-07-22 12:51:51.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Workflow-1'}, {'account_id': 9816, 'date': '2020-07-27 00:00:24.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 9816, 'date': '2020-07-27 00:00:55.000000000', 'content': 'Topic changed from bug/1889017-ussuri to bug/1889017'}, {'account_id': 16137, 'date': '2020-07-29 19:45:52.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

we wouldn't want to backport this behavior change"}, {'account_id': 9816, 'date': '2020-07-29 22:21:25.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

ï¼ Tobias

We need to backport this because setting public_endpoint parameter can cause actual problem in a deployment which depends on different keystone endpoint urls.
We actually use such kind of endpoint setup in TripleO and observed some issues in tempest API testing.

https://bugs.launchpad.net/tripleo/+bug/1889017

Note that the reason why I made public_endpoint set by default initially is that the parameter was required in some provider implementations(*1), but the parameter is no longer required since we migrated to bootstrap class and there are no requirements from keystone functionality perspective to have this parameter set by default.

(*1) And this is why I couldn't backport this directly to stable/train [1]

[1] https://review.opendev.org/#/c/742412/"}, {'account_id': 9816, 'date': '2020-08-02 23:19:03.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

recheck'}, {'account_id': 9816, 'date': '2020-08-03 22:01:19.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

recheck'}, {'account_id': 9414, 'date': '2020-08-04 03:52:26.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 16137, 'date': '2020-08-10 13:37:29.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

We are hardcoding public_endpoint in our Keystone configuration since otherwise Heat is broken. Keystone will expose the public_endpoint config option in the data exposed for version discovery and if that invalid i.e pointing to the default "localhost" (or: 127.0.0.1 etc) Heat will not be able to talk to Keystone when doing some operations.

So not sure if we should change behavior in the middle of a old release, not that it affects anybody hardcoding it but...'}, {'account_id': 14985, 'date': '2020-08-10 17:04:30.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}, {'account_id': 9816, 'date': '2020-08-11 07:47:19.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

@Tobias

I've checked keystone implementation, but in fact public_endpoint should have been set explicitly if your deployment requires it because public_bind_host and public_port doesn't have any effect unless public_endpoint is set.
This would mean that it causes low risks even if we remove this parameter by default and expect that users should have set public_endpoint correctly if they actually need it.

The problem with current default is that it actually breaks some deployment as I described in the associated bug. Because public_endpoint only accepts a single endpoint it will break deployment with multiple hosts for multiple endpoints. In TripleO deployment we have seprated networks for admin/internal and external endpoint and some api functionality is broken because of public_endpoint is set.

So I think we can justify this backport, and another revert patch I submitted for stable/train..."}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2020-07-22 06:20:25.000000000', 'message': 'Unset public_endpoint by default

When public_endpoint is set but different urls are used for endpoints
(especially for admin endpoint and public endpoint), it can cause
problem with self-url detection in keystone because it always assumes
that the url should be directed to that public_endpoint even when
a request comes from admin endpoint.

This patch makes public_endpoint unset by default to avoid issues in
the deployment where admin endpoint and public endpoint are still
separated.

Change-Id: Ia43e9dcd8085bbb0954b64873504398a85771032

commit_message:
Unset public_endpoint by default

When public_endpoint is set but different urls are used for endpoints
(especially for admin endpoint and public endpoint), it can cause
problem with self-url detection in keystone because it always assumes
that the url should be directed to that public_endpoint even when
a request comes from admin endpoint.

This patch makes public_endpoint unset by default to avoid issues in
the deployment where admin endpoint and public endpoint are still
separated.

Related-bug: #1889017
Change-Id: Ia43e9dcd8085bbb0954b64873504398a85771032
(cherry picked from commit a1a1e62012111e562dd2b1aabd0d6af3817eb307)

When public_endpoint parameter is set, keystone composes request urls
from that parameter. However this can cause incorrect url detection
especially for requests coming from admin endpoint, because we use
different urls for each endpoints (admin/internal/public) in TripleO
deployment.

deployment.

commit_message:
Unset keystone::public_endpoint

When public_endpoint parameter is set, keystone composes request urls
from that parameter. However this can cause incorrect url detection
especially for requests coming from admin endpoint, because we use
different urls for each endpoints (admin/internal/public) in TripleO
deployment.

This patch unsets that public_endpoint parameter and makes keystone
detect request urls by headers passed from haproxy.

Closes-bug: #1889017
Depends-on: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/742349/
Change-Id: Ib5f017e95f961c04da3201d75ed17424e168b270

commit_message:
Add missing security context template to mariadb-backup pod

Values are already overridden in values.yaml
https://github.com/openstack/openstack-helm-infra/blob/master/mariadb/values.yaml#L112-L122

Change-Id: I2931eb1408d1d8145b476a76ff8cfac36e9f2bfe

commit_message:
[goal] Migrate mistral-tempest-plugin jobs to focal

As per victoria cycle testing runtime and community goal[1]
we need to migrate upstream CI/CD to Ubuntu Focal(20.04).

Most of the Tempest jobs will be migrate automatically once devstack
base job start running on Focal(Depends-On).

Stable jobs testing stable branch needs to keep running on their supported
distro version which is bionic from stein till ussuri.

[1] https://governance.openstack.org/tc/goals/selected/victoria/migrate-ci-cd-jobs-to-ubuntu-focal.html

Change-Id: I3651224de022bff78840df8cd6ca95792dc5cce5
Story: #2007865
Task: #40196

commit_message:
Add exponential backoff to ratelimited requests

If we're ratelimited on a request, we should retry the request but back
off significantly.  Previously we're not really handling 429 any
different than other requests which may lead to the requests being
retried too quickly.

Change-Id: I3832332abdfd7daaf373dc0924fec268f159d774
Related-Bug: #1889372
Related-bug: #1889122
(cherry picked from commit d4f6eb64d4a54cfa90d4c1572ef54495f151fea5)

Allow the MetricsQdrNetwork to vary by role. This is needed
as the CephStorage, BlockStorage, and ObjectStorage roles need

Change-Id: I37611d516495b2b82b56a08df8b6ac38e0687083

(cherry picked from commit 0b2441cdc91c7e6a226e030927bde4be52e4591b)
'}]
commit_message:
Add j2 per-role MetricsQdrNetwork

Allow the MetricsQdrNetwork to vary by role. This is needed
as the CephStorage, BlockStorage, and ObjectStorage roles need
to use the storage network, while other roles need internal_api.

Change-Id: I37611d516495b2b82b56a08df8b6ac38e0687083
Signed-off-by: Ryan McCabe <rmccabe@redhat.com>
(cherry picked from commit 0b2441cdc91c7e6a226e030927bde4be52e4591b)

commit_message:
Switch from include to include_tasks.

Currently the main entry point to select the tasks use the deprecated
include tasks.  This leads to a lot of skipped tasks during the any
run.

If you run update you can see all ffwd upgrade tasks and upgrade tasks
being skipped.

This fix this by using include_tasks with the tag always.

Closes-Bug: #1889126
Change-Id: Ia3764e56b526834283ae46dafe0b94e8a6639c96
(cherry picked from commit 7f2d2f9140651588435da997d1e0282aef8fd584)

subject: Keep ceph-ansible 3 during whole FFU.
messages: [{'account_id': 6816, 'date': '2020-08-10 09:13:36.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Cherry Picked from branch master.'}, {'account_id': 11166, 'date': '2020-08-10 15:26:41.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2020-08-10 09:13:36.000000000', 'message': 'Keep ceph-ansible 3 during whole FFU.

To be able to FFU a ceph-enabled environment, it is required to
keep installed in the system ceph-ansible 3 in the Undercloud until the
converge step.

This patch adds the ceph-ansible package in the to_keep files, as well as
modifies some of the Undercloud upgrade tasks to make sure the package
survives to the leapp upgrade.

Co-Authored-By: Jesse Pretorius <jesse@odyssey4.me>
Change-Id: Ide724e398a5cd4fdaf77d1a127e9d5c32852ae6b
(cherry picked from commit d43cfabd5163c9c50aac21caccd3b4f6858cc72b)
'}]
commit_message:
Keep ceph-ansible 3 during whole FFU.

To be able to FFU a ceph-enabled environment, it is required to
keep installed in the system ceph-ansible 3 in the Undercloud until the
converge step.

This patch adds the ceph-ansible package in the to_keep files, as well as
modifies some of the Undercloud upgrade tasks to make sure the package
survives to the leapp upgrade.

Co-Authored-By: Jesse Pretorius <jesse@odyssey4.me>
Change-Id: Ide724e398a5cd4fdaf77d1a127e9d5c32852ae6b
(cherry picked from commit d43cfabd5163c9c50aac21caccd3b4f6858cc72b)

commit_message:
Prevent ovn dbs related facts to run on each step.

Put them as vars for the relevant block or in the conditional.

Partial-Bug: #1886932

Please move upgrade job back as it's relevant"}, {'account_id': 29775, 'date': '2020-07-28 03:14:42.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

> Please move upgrade job back as it's relevant

Hello Sergii,

Thank you for review.

tripleo-ci-centos-7-standalone-upgrade-stein --> Is upgrade from rocky to stein upgrade

As far as I can see it never triggers here on the train branch and this job seems leftover on train branch.

Zuul build history:-

https://zuul.openstack.org/builds?job_name=tripleo-ci-centos-7-standalone-upgrade-stein&branch=stable%2Ftrain

Reason in tripleo-ci-centos-7-standalone-upgrade-stein is defined to run only on stein branch only.	

https://github.com/openstack/tripleo-ci/blob/4705cc4002812d8de8681efedf731a71ee303d70/zuul.d/standalone-jobs.yaml#L98

To me, it seems tripleo-ci-centos-7-standalone-upgrade-stein is not the correct job on train branch. The correct upgrade job which should be ideally present here is i.e:-

tripleo-ci-centos-7-standalone-upgrade-train (c7 stein to c7 train upgrade)
tripleo-ci-centos-8-standalone-upgrade-train  ---> This is currently not possible because based on current workflow it tries to deploy stein on c8 and we don't have stein on c8 bits(stein is c7 based in upstream). Also, we don't have leapp upgrade jobs(c7 stein to c8 train) in upstream ci. 

tripleo-ci-centos-7-standalone-upgrade-train (c7 stein to c7 train upgrade) seems more practically feasible to me here if we really need upgrade coverage here(till yet we don't have that stein -> train upgrade coverage).

We can further discuss internally among tripleo-ci based on your inputs about coverage need."}, {'account_id': 8449, 'date': '2020-07-28 07:41:32.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2

> Please move upgrade job back as it's relevant

o/ sergii this is train so that job is never executed for this branch (see the job definition it has stable/stein in branches as it should do  https://github.com/openstack/tripleo-ci/blob/4705cc4002812d8de8681efedf731a71ee303d70/zuul.d/standalone-jobs.yaml#L98

so it is safe to remove it from the *train* layout.

I just checked and it is not in the stein layout so in fact it doesn't even run *at all* looks like.

last run was in 2019 https://zuul.openstack.org/builds?job_name=tripleo-ci-centos-7-standalone-upgrade-stein&project=openstack%2Ftripleo-upgrade

so it needs adding to the stein branch... the removal here is irrelevant to anything"}, {'account_id': 8449, 'date': '2020-07-28 07:47:27.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

> > Please move upgrade job back as it's relevant

added to stable/stein with https://review.opendev.org/743477"}, {'account_id': 8449, 'date': '2020-07-28 11:14:27.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

@Sandeep Well, there 2 strategies

Second strategy is what you propose. I'll try fix trabbit mq issue and then merge this one. in that case we won't need to do extra steps."}, {'account_id': 29775, 'date': '2020-08-04 15:44:26.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3: -Code-Review

Hello Sergii,

I totally agree with you here, tripleo-ci-centos-8-scenario000-multinode-oooq-container-updates-train is already (non-voting) currently - I am removing my -1 if you want to merge like this change.

On side note: currently we atleast have some coverage for updates with tripleo-ci-centos-7-scenario000-multinode-oooq-container-updates, this job we are removing while porting to c8 job version - So I think better to keep tripleo-ci-centos-7-scenario000-multinode-oooq-container-updates till tripleo-ci-centos-8-scenario000-multinode-oooq-container-updates-train is fixed."}, {'account_id': 8449, 'date': '2020-08-05 08:19:40.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review-1

commit_message:
Port jobs from centos7 to centos8

This change ports train jobs from centos7 to centos8.

This patch also removes below job :
Removing centos-7-standalone-upgrade-stein
for stable train, As this job does rocky to stein upgrade.

https://tree.taiga.io/project/tripleo-ci-board/task/1905?kanban-status=1447274

Change-Id: I3dc8606fc2f13abe4364576ae75e7ffc466db813

commit_message:
Use container-tools:2.0 instead of default rhel8 stream

container-tools:2.0 is going to ship podman-1.6.4-15 the fix needed
for [1] and container-tools:rhel8 is going to ship podman 1.9.3
and since rhel8 is the default stream, we need to disable it and enable
2.0 as needed.

[1] https://review.opendev.org/#/c/736173/

Change-Id: I270d13654281f15d5ece35ec7640798f79e891e4

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-07-30 16:03:11.000000000', 'message': 'Add CephAnsibleRepo into upgrade lifecycle environment files.

During the whole FFU, the ceph-ansible 3 package is left in the Undercloud
getting upgraded once the upgrade converge steps finishes. One of the
consequences of leaving ceph-3 running in a RHEL8 system is that the
repository gets lost. Therefore, the ceph-ansible 3 package appears as
being provided by @System.
This patch sets the CephAnsibleRepo heat parameter to @System during the
upgrade prepara step and sets it back to its default value during converge.

NOTE FOR DOWNSTREAM: CephAnsibleRepo defaults to
rhceph-4-tools-for-rhel-8-x86_64-rpms downstream. Make sure the value gets
changed when cherry-picking.

Change-Id: Ie02a3a733f8bce8429c7e693f4e2766b289c66ab
'}, {'created': '2020-07-31 08:39:47.000000000', 'message': '[Train Only] Add CephAnsibleRepo into upgrade lifecycle environment files.

repository gets lost. Therefore, the ceph-ansible 3 package appears as

This patch sets the CephAnsibleRepo heat parameter to @System during the

NOTE FOR DOWNSTREAM: CephAnsibleRepo defaults to

Change-Id: Ie02a3a733f8bce8429c7e693f4e2766b289c66ab
'}, {'created': '2020-08-03 13:32:19.000000000', 'message': '[Train Only] Add CephAnsibleWarning into upgrade lifecycle environment files.

During the whole FFU, the ceph-ansible 3 package is left in the Undercloud
getting upgraded once the upgrade converge steps finishes. One of the
consequences of leaving ceph-3 running in a RHEL8 system is that the
repository gets lost. Therefore, the ceph-ansible 3 From-repo field is lost,
which is the value checked by ceph-ansible validations.
This patch sets to false the CephAnsibleWrning heat parameter to skip the
ceph-ansible repo validation and sets it back to true during the converge
step, so the validation will be in order when we will run the ceph upgrade
step.

Depends-On: I7083e4dc8b4d14f33837ffe7cc6299ea1ac4b70f

commit_message:
[Train Only] Add CephAnsibleWarning into upgrade lifecycle environment files.

During the whole FFU, the ceph-ansible 3 package is left in the Undercloud
getting upgraded once the upgrade converge steps finishes. One of the
consequences of leaving ceph-3 running in a RHEL8 system is that the
repository gets lost. Therefore, the ceph-ansible 3 From-repo field is lost,
which is the value checked by ceph-ansible validations.
This patch sets to false the CephAnsibleWrning heat parameter to skip the
ceph-ansible repo validation and sets it back to true during the converge
step, so the validation will be in order when we will run the ceph upgrade
step.

Change-Id: Ie02a3a733f8bce8429c7e693f4e2766b289c66ab

[{'created': '2020-08-10 11:10:58.000000000', 'message': 'Fix broken link in Tacker Rocky Spec

The specification "Affinity/Anti-affinity policies for VDUs",
in section "Proposed change" refers to an ETSI document,
ETSI GS NFV-IFA 011. The referred URL [1] is a broken link,
and the correct link is [2].
[1] http://www.etsi.org/deliver/etsi_gs/NFV-IFA/001_099/010/02.01.01_60/gs_NFV-IFA011v020101p.pdf
[2] https://www.etsi.org/deliver/etsi_gs/NFV-IFA/001_099/011/02.01.01_60/gs_NFV-IFA011v020101p.pdf

Change-Id: I15ccc870920a6f76316a7abcdf223132ad55e008
Closes-Bug: #1891006
'}]
commit_message:
Fix broken link in Tacker Rocky Spec

The specification "Affinity/Anti-affinity policies for VDUs",
in section "Proposed change" refers to an ETSI document,
ETSI GS NFV-IFA 011. The referred URL [1] is a broken link,
and the correct link is [2].
[1] http://www.etsi.org/deliver/etsi_gs/NFV-IFA/001_099/010/02.01.01_60/gs_NFV-IFA011v020101p.pdf
[2] https://www.etsi.org/deliver/etsi_gs/NFV-IFA/001_099/011/02.01.01_60/gs_NFV-IFA011v020101p.pdf

Change-Id: I15ccc870920a6f76316a7abcdf223132ad55e008
Closes-Bug: #1891006

commit_message:
Rename README.txt to README.rst

This repo is not properly retired. Retired repos can only have two files:
- README.rst
- gitreview

To cleanup the retirement of this repo, keeping these two files only and
removing the other remaining files if there is any.

Change-Id: I8bf9566d9067b379e7be6ece4dc4e728d109f855
Detail: https://etherpad.opendev.org/p/tc-retirement-cleanup

commit_message:
Drop neutron-vpnaas from legacy projects

The change I8c89a62566fdb332450b07448e96058933852675 missed removing
vpnaas from the legacy projects list again as it was revived.  This
patch removes it from there.

Change-Id: I1f8c946f812e7e61ddb7ad8cea50e231f26b7a5b

commit_message:
Fix wrong capacity in pool_stat for DellEMC manila drivers.

DellEMC manila drivers have bugs in returning capacity in pool_stat.
The current powermax/vnx manila return size in MB and unity manila
returns size in bytes.

Change-Id: I1a2c28548d02eee6632313a41a5c4d8ab6ad9532
Closes-bug: #1890372
Closes-bug: #1890375
Closes-bug: #1890376

I'm +1 because tests pass, but I confess I don't really understand all the changes.  I'll promote to +2 if we can get +1s from folks who do."}, {'account_id': 6928, 'date': '2018-05-03 14:07:33.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 6928, 'date': '2019-07-09 15:46:25.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow-1

Fair enough, I guess there are only three unit tests in the whole project. I will point out that oslotest provides some standard ways to configure unit tests (timeouts, logging, etc.) that are useful even if no features are explicitly used, but the tests here seem to be simple enough that it probably doesn't matter.

There does appear to be a merge conflict, however."}, {'account_id': 11904, 'date': '2020-03-07 19:20:20.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Yep, I'm good with this."}]

commit_message:
Reduce need for openstack specific requirements

- openstackdocstheme is only needed for docs builds. Move this and some
  missing doc-related requirements into the current convention of
  doc/requirements.txt so they are not installed when just using the
  library.
- oslotest is not used directly. It only helped pick up self.useFixture
  from testtools. Since nothing else is needed, just use testtools
  directly.

Change-Id: Ibfda6fbe91deaa846b62732c38eef93c393c926f

commit_message:
Reload files in policy_dirs on primary file change

It was determined that rules from policy files located in the directory
specified in the policy_dirs option (/etc/<config_dir>/policy.d by
default) are not re-applied after the rules from the primary policy file
is re-applied due to a change.

This change introduces additional behavior to make sure the rules from
policy_dirs are reapplied if there is a change to the primary policy
file.

Change-Id: I8a6f8e971d881365c41ea409966723319d5b239a
Closes-Bug: #1880959
Related-Bug: #1880847
(cherry picked from commit 75677a31108243e0adddc89f1fbf669053f9573b)
(cherry picked from commit c8c138e69d9189345a7366a10b0779ef70b7250e)
(cherry picked from commit 5904564bf13bbac7d66e00ec6312487c507f09c4)
(cherry picked from commit a49f31d3fc7690e3d15bc2428660b537967c89cc)

[{'created': '2020-07-31 16:39:33.000000000', 'message': "Switch from handlers to tasks

Handlers normally don't run until the end of a play execution. Since we
are forcing a handler run in the middle of the tasks there is not a good
reason to use handlers for this case. Additionally we're not relying on
this handler anywhere else.  Because of this, let's switch to explicit
tasks that check changed results instead of handlers.  We've seen issues
with trying to use handlers in ansible when not using a linear strategy.

Change-Id: I4eb5ece7d5c1d25f5beacd9e21e20ae9f3d45c17
Closes-Bug: #1888853
(cherry picked from commit d057ad0b6a56110b49796bc2d6a331dd4ce9045f)
"}]
commit_message:
Switch from handlers to tasks

Handlers normally don't run until the end of a play execution. Since we
are forcing a handler run in the middle of the tasks there is not a good
reason to use handlers for this case. Additionally we're not relying on
this handler anywhere else.  Because of this, let's switch to explicit
tasks that check changed results instead of handlers.  We've seen issues
with trying to use handlers in ansible when not using a linear strategy.

Change-Id: I4eb5ece7d5c1d25f5beacd9e21e20ae9f3d45c17
Closes-Bug: #1888853
(cherry picked from commit d057ad0b6a56110b49796bc2d6a331dd4ce9045f)

subject: Use a 'params' hash for authtoken parameters
messages:
[{'account_id': 5733, 'date': '2020-07-30 01:35:07.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 16137, 'date': '2020-07-30 14:02:18.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

(1 comment)

This "params" approach is interesting and I think it adds some value that users doesn't have to send patches for parameters that doesn't exist. However I also think it's somewhat annoying working with hashes so not sure if I'm for deprecating/removing the parameters even though it makes sense for modules such as puppet-nova etc that use oslo/openstacklib/keystone modules to configure some resources.'}, {'account_id': 14985, 'date': '2020-07-31 13:48:43.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 9816, 'date': '2020-08-02 23:31:42.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

(3 comments)'}, {'account_id': 3153, 'date': '2020-08-10 17:52:18.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]

in nearly 30 different puppet projects. For options without defaults,
defining these individually in each puppet-* project doesn't

in the keystone::resource::authtoken class.

This change adds a params parameter which is a hash of options to
pass through to the authtoken resource. The individual params are
still used as defaults, but any keys set in the params hash override
them. I propose deprecating these individual parameters in a future

commit_message:
Use a 'params' hash for authtoken parameters

Currently adding a new authtoken parameter requires changes
in nearly 30 different puppet projects. For options without defaults,
defining these individually in each puppet-* project doesn't
appear to add any value since validation is already happening
in the keystone::resource::authtoken class.

This change adds a params parameter which is a hash of options to
pass through to the authtoken resource. The individual params are
still used as defaults, but any keys set in the params hash override
them. I propose deprecating these individual parameters in a future
commit.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/743858/
Change-Id: I695834ac03a52d8569e50db600676a89e165491d

commit_message:
Add toggle for sensitive data within keystone

This change will allow deployers to expose sensitive data as needed.

> This change also fixes the tests for keystone. The role test was
  broken because the use of test-deps needed to be updated for the new
  repo layout.

Change-Id: I200efe00b735a17a996fbfe64e3f0f4d4c813f73
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kecarter@redhat.com>
(cherry picked from commit 8cc51067d83ad8245ced0a0d62084de8717415d1)

commit_message:
Port jobs from centos7 to centos8

This change ports train jobs from centos7 to centos8.

However, we are keeping c7 multinode containers job for c7 coverage
and upgrade jobs as an exception because c8 stein -> c8 train is
currently not feasible because we don't have stein bits on c8)

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/738375/
Change-Id: I1fc5af1476a82bdc3eed80ce979954edcf591361
Story: https://tree.taiga.io/project/tripleo-ci-board/task/1900

commit_message:
Change non-tinyipa jobs to use multiple cores

A large ramdisk image tends to take an undesirable amount
of time performing the initial uncompression into memory before
the system is booted and available. This sets the number of CPU cores
by default for all jobs to 2, and only sets that back to 1 where
TinyIPA is being used.

Change-Id: I88c57a1345edb1b14c760753638ad927641b34a2
(cherry picked from commit 44d56c559b5cc634911b5cdea42ae1b22aa4cb76)

commit_message:
Cleanup old periodic pbr jobs

These jobs are legacy devstack-gate jobs and are going to be removed.
Clean them out of project-config so that we can remove the jobs from pbr
entirely.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/745171/
Change-Id: I8e2313e45362ad53f437e0ac428ffdf11e2e9f6a

commit_message:
Update Puppet requirement to >= 6.0.0

... because now all openstack-puppet modules support Puppet 6 only .

Change-Id: Ia0d51665971f1fe3c7394f5a398ac70216ec27e2

commit_message:
Add certmonger-etcd-refresh.sh script

Add a script that refreshes the etcd cert and key files in all
containers that reference them. This includes etcd itself, plus any
cinder services that access etcd.

Change-Id: I0ea26253355a57b3721bfa6ceef3972eaabc5b1d
(cherry picked from commit 95db8b4947f0a80a0109131eda8f66ed4acb90d6)
(cherry picked from commit 37b8666f64d8d8e65c483ec37efe99ac763f62c9)

subject: Begin work to modernize pbr's integration testing
messages: [{'account_id': 4146, 'date': '2020-08-06 15:35:18.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 4146, 'date': '2020-08-06 15:43:03.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 4146, 'date': '2020-08-06 16:03:13.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 4146, 'date': '2020-08-06 16:18:58.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 4146, 'date': '2020-08-06 16:58:48.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 5.'}, {'account_id': 4146, 'date': '2020-08-06 17:46:11.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 6.'}, {'account_id': 4146, 'date': '2020-08-10 14:17:18.000000000', 'content': 'Topic changed from modernize-integration-testing to native-zuulv3-migration'}, {'account_id': 11904, 'date': '2020-08-10 15:19:41.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 5263, 'date': '2020-08-10 17:48:03.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2020-08-06 15:35:18.000000000', 'message': "WIP: Begin work to modernize pbr's integration testing

PBR does integration testing by installing all of openstack's python
projects to ensure we can install all of them in a variety of different
ways with different pip versions. Unfortunately, these jobs are still
using devstack-gate. We can simplify them significantly because zuul is
now doing what devstack-gate does and provides repos configured the way
we want them to be.

This change update the jobs to drop devstack-gate and simply consume
zuul's repo prep.

Change-Id: I77a38c4611dc28db79d6f25d96ad0de36b224c98
"}, {'created': '2020-08-06 15:43:03.000000000', 'message': "WIP: Begin work to modernize pbr's integration testing

projects to ensure we can install all of them in a variety of different
ways with different pip versions. Unfortunately, these jobs are still

commit_message:
Begin work to modernize pbr's integration testing

PBR does integration testing by installing all of openstack's python
projects to ensure we can install all of them in a variety of different
ways with different pip versions. Unfortunately, these jobs are still
using devstack-gate. We can simplify them significantly because zuul is
now doing what devstack-gate does and provides repos configured the way
we want them to be.

This change updates the jobs to drop devstack-gate and simply consume
zuul's repo prep.

A follow up will remove the old legacy jobs as they need to be removed
from project-config first.

Needed-By: https://review.opendev.org/745189
Change-Id: I77a38c4611dc28db79d6f25d96ad0de36b224c98

commit_message:
Flesh out FakeImage for extra_properties

The FakeImage in test_images_resource.py is missing a lot of standard
properties. That becomes a problem as soon as you add extra_properties,
which gets delegated to for any missing property by ImageTarget. Thus,
if that fixture has extra_properties defined on it, any other base
property (i.e. checksum, size, etc) will be looked for inside that dict
if it is not defined on the fixture itself.

Thus, this adds fake values for all those properties and adds
extra_properties={} so that subsequent patches can put things into
extra_properties without a bunch of work.

Change-Id: I4b63706927b599eb343b614f0c396f699378e14b

commit_message:
Remove propagate_uplink_status API related tests

Due to the related bug we can't have test
test_create_port_without_propagate_uplink_status in
neutron-tempest-plugin repo anymore as this repo is branchless and we
run tests from it against neutron master branch and against stable
branches. Now default value of the "propagate_uplink_status" attribute
was changed in master branch but not in stable branches so this test
would fail always.

Because of that those tests are now moved to be in fullstack - see [1]
for details and we don't need them in neutron-tempest-plugin anymore so
this patch is removing them from neutron-tempest-plugin.

[1] https://review.opendev.org/#/c/745521/

Change-Id: I79581da5b2cb3df6fa9407f1f06509513ac7f96d
Closes-Bug: #1890842

messages: [{'account_id': 9816, 'date': '2020-07-22 12:51:38.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 9816, 'date': '2020-07-22 12:51:56.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow-1'}, {'account_id': 9816, 'date': '2020-07-22 12:52:54.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 9816, 'date': '2020-07-22 15:17:34.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 9816, 'date': '2020-07-27 00:02:29.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4: Commit message was updated.'}, {'account_id': 9816, 'date': '2020-07-27 00:02:42.000000000', 'content': 'Topic set to bug/1889017'}, {'account_id': 9816, 'date': '2020-08-07 14:50:58.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:\n\nrecheck'}, {'account_id': 14985, 'date': '2020-08-10 17:04:50.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 3153, 'date': '2020-08-10 17:52:58.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2020-07-22 12:51:38.000000000', 'message': 'Revert "Do not set public_bind_host and public_port in eventlet section"

When public_endpoint is set but different urls are used for endpoints
(especially for admin endpoint and public endpoint), it can cause
problem with self-url detection in keystone because it always assumes
that the url should be directed to that public_endpoint even when
a request comes from admin endpoint.

This patch reverts previous change which made public_endpoint parameter
generated automatically if unset, so that public_endpoint is not set
by default.

Note: We can't directly remove public_endpoint by default because
this is mandatory for provider implementations in stable/train. Thus
we need to revert the previous change to unset public_bind_host and
public_port so that these 2 parameters can be refered from proviers
instead of public_endpoint, in the deployments which can't depend on
public_endpoint.

This reverts commit d58fcfe75e887af3a1e6f6e9aa9e69752fec5a18.

Change-Id: I4feb0dfb858bcf2ff5d97341908abd11f6939b32

commit_message:
Revert "Do not set public_bind_host and public_port in eventlet section"

When public_endpoint is set but different urls are used for endpoints
(especially for admin endpoint and public endpoint), it can cause
problem with self-url detection in keystone because it always assumes
that the url should be directed to that public_endpoint even when
a request comes from admin endpoint.

This patch reverts previous change which made public_endpoint parameter
generated automatically if unset, so that public_endpoint is not set
by default.

Note 1: We can't directly remove public_endpoint by default because
this parameter is mandatory for providers in stable/train.
Thus we need to revert the previous change to unset public_bind_host
and public_port so that these 2 parameters can be refered from proviers
instead of public_endpoint, in the deployments which can't depend on
public_endpoint.

This reverts commit d58fcfe75e887af3a1e6f6e9aa9e69752fec5a18.

Related-bug: #1889017
Change-Id: I4feb0dfb858bcf2ff5d97341908abd11f6939b32

commit_message:
Expose vhost_custom_fragment

It is provided by the Puppet class 'openstacklib::wsgi::apache'.
This change exposes it for the Aodh service.

Change-Id: Ic5055279770342d244ef3a4592067351981b459a

commit_message:
Add backend coordination url option to producer

Producers that are deployed in an HA environment that do not have
a coordination url set will produce multiple copies of the same
thing and operate in standalone mode.

Change-Id: Idb5ecfd027728dc0c85ffac5ce08d475e6ea8cb6

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-08-10 12:58:47.000000000', 'message': 'Fix Barbican client (Castellan) with TLS (part 2)

This patch is a continuation of
I6a174468bd91d214c08477b93c88032a45c137be for the nova-cell role, which
was missed.

The Castellan (Barbican client) has different parameters to control
the used CA file.
This patch uses them.
Moreover, this aligns Barbican with other services by defaulting
its client config to the internal endpoint.

See also [1].

[1] https://bugs.launchpad.net/castellan/+bug/1876102

Closes-Bug: #1886615

Change-Id: I056f3eebcf87bcbaaf89fdd0dc1f46d143db7785
(cherry picked from commit 97e26b49cdb7962a1dc6f1a236a0c565ccba0d77)
'}]
commit_message:
Fix Barbican client (Castellan) with TLS (part 2)

This patch is a continuation of
I6a174468bd91d214c08477b93c88032a45c137be for the nova-cell role, which
was missed.

The Castellan (Barbican client) has different parameters to control
the used CA file.
This patch uses them.
Moreover, this aligns Barbican with other services by defaulting
its client config to the internal endpoint.

See also [1].

[1] https://bugs.launchpad.net/castellan/+bug/1876102

Closes-Bug: #1886615

Change-Id: I056f3eebcf87bcbaaf89fdd0dc1f46d143db7785
(cherry picked from commit 97e26b49cdb7962a1dc6f1a236a0c565ccba0d77)

commit_message:
objects: Update keypairs when saving an instance

The keypair of a server is updated when rebuilding the server with a
keypair. This function has been added since API microversion 2.54.
However the 'keypairs' of the instance object is not saved when saving
the instance object currently.

Make the instance object update the 'keypairs' field when saving the
instance object.

Changes:
	nova/tests/functional/regressions/test_bug_1843708.py

NOTE(stephenfin): Changes are necessary since 'PlacementFixture' moved
in stable/stein with change Idaed39629095f86d24a54334c699a26c218c6593
but it's still in the old place here.

Change-Id: I8a2726b39d0444de8c35480024078a97430f5d0c
Closes-Bug: #1843708
Co-authored-by: Stephen Finucane <stephenfin@redhat.com>
(cherry picked from commit 086796021b189c3ac64805ed8f6bde833906d284)
(cherry picked from commit aed86ee5d6289edf1baf9fe0b2a9e509031fdd25)
(cherry picked from commit b971dc82cb524fe86284c95ec671e2bad1c2874f)
(cherry picked from commit 0bc5a4ecb524a73aacb5d0dd2887799885bdbb14)

subject: DNM: Try to debug spurious DB file failure
messages:
[{'account_id': 4393, 'date': '2020-08-07 19:31:31.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 4393, 'date': '2020-08-07 23:27:11.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Mike, I'm trying to add some testing against a DB here in glance, which I think is mostly stubbed out for all their others tests, other than some where they start a full API server and hit that.

If you grab this patch and run:

 tox -efunction-pyXX -- test_images_import_locking --serial

I think you'll see the error I'm hitting every time. Basically, the db_sync() in the setup_database() of the test class always works the first time, but fails on any subsequent calls. The DB file does exist, the directory is writable, but it fails. I think maybe there's some internal state I'm not resetting and it's still trying to use the DB file from the first test, which has been reaped.

Can you help?"}, {'account_id': 11816, 'date': '2020-08-08 02:20:09.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 11816, 'date': '2020-08-08 02:21:09.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

alembic env.py is getting the DB information from a different source than that which the test code is changing on each test.  im not sure where these tempfile names come from but they change each time.   tests run with the change i made here.'}, {'account_id': 4393, 'date': '2020-08-10 13:44:27.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

Mike, thanks so much for figuring this out. This gives me exactly what I need to proceed!'}, {'account_id': 4393, 'date': '2020-08-10 17:11:11.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2020-08-07 19:31:31.000000000', 'message': 'DNM: Try to debug spurious DB file failure

Change-Id: I66cdd29341089ef89123fa1f5420258433a660fe
'}, {'created': '2020-08-08 02:20:09.000000000', 'message': 'DNM: Try to debug spurious DB file failure

Alembic env.py is using oslo_db.sqlalchemy.enginefacade
for connectivity but the test suite seems to be creating
a new CONF.database.connection tempfile directory + file
each time and assigning it to _FACADE, which is a legacy facade.

not sure where glance wants to go here but switching
env.py to use _FACADE allows the tests in question to pass.

Change-Id: I66cdd29341089ef89123fa1f5420258433a660fe
'}]
commit_message:
DNM: Try to debug spurious DB file failure

Alembic env.py is using oslo_db.sqlalchemy.enginefacade
for connectivity but the test suite seems to be creating
a new CONF.database.connection tempfile directory + file
each time and assigning it to _FACADE, which is a legacy facade.

not sure where glance wants to go here but switching
env.py to use _FACADE allows the tests in question to pass.

Change-Id: I66cdd29341089ef89123fa1f5420258433a660fe

commit_message:
Pin Ironic Tempest Plugin

Pin the ironic-tempest-plugin to an older version so
we don't run the net set of tests with wholedisk + partition
testing.

Also removes CoreOS jobs as CoreOS is EOL and no longer receiving
any updates.

And also signals to the user to try and manually install python-pip
as opposed to install the package from the package manager as
older mirrors have older versions at this point and we are
risking breaking things by automatically doing so. This should
fix test jobs on ubuntu-xenial as there is a conflict in the
repositories.

    python-pip : Depends: python-pip-whl (= 8.1.1-2ubuntu0.4) but 9.0.1-3~3 is to be installed

Change-Id: I6b689bd16dfe6fa849e876f056f1c5cfd1937764

Currently, we are overriding 'install_command' to use 'pip'. This is
considered poor behavior and 'python -m pip' should be used instead:

https://snarky.ca/why-you-should-use-python-m-pip/

It turns out that this is the the default value provided by tox:

https://tox.readthedocs.io/en/latest/config.html#conf-install_command

So we can remove the line and simply use the default value.

Change-Id: I76cd33019be6d7e3dbc6e1d94e64ee1286255839

commit_message:
Stop configuring install_command in tox.

Currently, we are overriding 'install_command' to use 'pip'. This is
considered poor behavior and 'python -m pip' should be used instead:

https://snarky.ca/why-you-should-use-python-m-pip/

It turns out that this is the the default value provided by tox:

https://tox.readthedocs.io/en/latest/config.html#conf-install_command

So we can remove the line and simply use the default value.

Change-Id: I76cd33019be6d7e3dbc6e1d94e64ee1286255839

commit_message:
Unify post upgrade tags.

There were two different tags for the post upgrade tasks,
the overcloud_post_controller and the ffu_overcloud_post.
This patch uses the same tag, ffu_overcloud_post, for both.

Change-Id: I5511605a88c65788eb647df33815a5b19aca3d16

subject: Stop using a conditional for role tasks
messages: [{'account_id': 14985, 'date': '2020-08-05 21:07:20.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Cherry Picked from branch master.'}, {'account_id': 11090, 'date': '2020-08-06 11:18:55.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 3153, 'date': '2020-08-10 12:38:10.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2020-08-05 21:07:20.000000000', 'message': "Stop using a conditional for role tasks

Currently this task definition is causing the following warning to be
thrown at execution time:

    [WARNING]: conditional statements should not include jinja2 templating
    delimiters such as {{ }} or {% %}. Found: '{{ playbook_dir }}/{{
    _task_file_path }}' is exists

There is no reason to be using this conditional with a variable since
this file path is known when we create the playbook. Additionally we
don't need to use the playbook_dir because we're not using it in the

Change-Id: I368e99d2384469ca166e2e2b00e8621b7afe72db
(cherry picked from commit ea62bcf150885ca91aeb37f098d60bf51cd5a7b7)

commit_message:
Stop using a conditional for role tasks

Currently this task definition is causing the following warning to be
thrown at execution time:

    [WARNING]: conditional statements should not include jinja2 templating
    delimiters such as {{ }} or {% %}. Found: '{{ playbook_dir }}/{{
    _task_file_path }}' is exists

There is no reason to be using this conditional with a variable since
this file path is known when we create the playbook. Additionally we
don't need to use the playbook_dir because we're not using it in the
include_tasks. This allows us to specifically express the file that
we're using for these tasks inclusions rather than relying on a
conditional that is not recommended.

Change-Id: I368e99d2384469ca166e2e2b00e8621b7afe72db
(cherry picked from commit ea62bcf150885ca91aeb37f098d60bf51cd5a7b7)

commit_message:
Mesure l3 agent connectivity in seconds instead of percentage.

This make the ping check independent of the task time.  We can now
specify in absolute time how long we tolerate a ping loss during the
ping test.

We set this to 0 by default for update as no such cut should happen
during this workflow.

For other tasks it's 60 seconds.

We also maintain a percentage check for tasks that are very short in
total time (less than 10min for instance) as the total number of
seconds there could be less than 60 seconds, but with a 100% packet
loss.

Eventually, we shield printf against locale that would use a comma as
a separator for number decimal and make sure it's always a point.

Change-Id: I69ac4ee4f7eb3214c925686c1efd1bd2f5972185

commit_message:
Add exponential backoff to ratelimited requests

If we're ratelimited on a request, we should retry the request but back
off significantly.  Previously we're not really handling 429 any
different than other requests which may lead to the requests being
retried too quickly.

Change-Id: I3832332abdfd7daaf373dc0924fec268f159d774
Related-Bug: #1889372
Related-bug: #1889122
(cherry picked from commit d4f6eb64d4a54cfa90d4c1572ef54495f151fea5)

commit_message:
More flexible definitions of conditions in rules

Added `invert_conditions_outcome` and
`condition_join` to introspection rule.
It allows to use boolean algebra logic
when rule should be applied using conditions.

Change-Id: I23714b1614aa0df8a6d4a531746f6300523b16da
Story: #2007649
Task: #39710

subject: Revert "tests: Resolves issues with kombu > 4.6.8"
messages:
[{'account_id': 15334, 'date': '2020-07-24 15:08:19.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 28522, 'date': '2020-07-24 15:21:31.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 12907, 'date': '2020-07-24 15:30:12.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

In https://review.opendev.org/#/c/742609/ :
> This should probably be reverted. Max version of kombu supported in stable/ussuri is 4.6.8, so we shouldn't need to have compatibility code for newer versions.

That is not listed as a requirement in
https://docs.openstack.org/project-team-guide/stable-branches.html#appropriate-fixes
The original patch is a small test only change, thus it matches the stable-branches requirements.

While upper constraints shows what is supported and tested, there is no requirement to forbid changes to make newer versions work.

This should not be reverted as otherwise the latest OpenStack release won't work on any of Debian testing, Fedora Rawhide, openSUSE Tumbleweed. Also the compatibility is for a minor version change."}, {'account_id': 12907, 'date': '2020-07-24 15:30:18.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Backport-Candidate-1'}, {'account_id': 12907, 'date': '2020-07-24 15:33:45.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: -Backport-Candidate Code-Review-1'}, {'account_id': 11904, 'date': '2020-07-24 15:38:29.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

> In https://review.opendev.org/#/c/742609/ :
 > > This should probably be reverted. Max version of kombu supported
 > in stable/ussuri is 4.6.8, so we shouldn't need to have
 > compatibility code for newer versions.
 > 
 > That is not listed as a requirement in
 > https://docs.openstack.org/project-team-guide/stable-branches.html#appropriate-fixes
 > The original patch is a small test only change, thus it matches the
 > stable-branches requirements.
 > 
 > While upper constraints shows what is supported and tested, there
 > is no requirement to forbid changes to make newer versions work.
 > 
 > This should not be reverted as otherwise the latest OpenStack
 > release won't work on any of Debian testing, Fedora Rawhide,
 > openSUSE Tumbleweed. Also the compatibility is for a minor version
 > change.

Is this testing not actually using upper-constraints? It shouldn't be possible to even hit this if constraints are being handled correctly."}, {'account_id': 12907, 'date': '2020-07-24 17:23:34.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

You are thinking about installing via pip with not distribution provided packages, I'm talking about deb/rpm packages. Those distributions all ship a kombu that is newer than upper-constraints."}, {'account_id': 11904, 'date': '2020-07-24 17:28:40.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

> You are thinking about installing via pip with not distribution
 > provided packages, I'm talking about deb/rpm packages. Those
 > distributions all ship a kombu that is newer than upper-constraints.

No, that's also what I mean. The upper-constraints used in our testing is supposed to be used as the definitive lists for downstream packagers to know what versions are supported to be coinstallable. If a distro is packaging a version higher than what is defined in upper-constraints, then that is an error in packaging.

But fair enough, this should be harmless, so even though it should not be required, I guess it doesn't hurt much."}, {'account_id': 15334, 'date': '2020-08-10 15:43:41.000000000', 'content': "Abandoned

Sean's happy to keep this as-is so let's do that"}]

commit_message:
Update constraint pyOpenSSL 19.1.0 for byte array issue

pyOpenSSL 19.1.0 fixes the byte array issue[1] which
startd failing the patrole stable/train|stein jobs

- https://zuul.opendev.org/t/openstack/build/2f1e7e415b074b62ae54845bd72dbef5

those jobs passing with this patch:
- https://zuul.opendev.org/t/openstack/build/65878b6e4790458f9f6bb141470cdd84

pyOpenSSL 19.1.0 need cryptography 2.8

[1] https://github.com/pyca/pyopenssl/pull/852

Change-Id: I254a9abce41551c19990a8285aa592189bf00206

'}, {'created': '2020-08-07 13:53:42.000000000', 'message': 'Add ensure-tox support.

Use ensure_global_symlinks from ensure-tox to fix the CI fail. We need
to do that, because when we install the new sub environment in the new
project the tox is not visible. With the ensure_global_symlinks we do a
symlink into /usr/local/bin path.

Co-authored-by: Bernard Cafarelli <bcafarel@redhat.com>

Change-Id: I575e42fe15f16d0bd51597a540a13c4e384ec096
'}]
commit_message:
Add ensure-tox support.

Use ensure_global_symlinks from ensure-tox to fix the CI fail. We need
to do that, because when we install the new sub environment in the new
project the tox is not visible. With the ensure_global_symlinks we do a
symlink into /usr/local/bin path.

Co-authored-by: Bernard Cafarelli <bcafarel@redhat.com>

Change-Id: I575e42fe15f16d0bd51597a540a13c4e384ec096

Congratulations, you've proposed your first change in OpenDev.

Your submission will now be tested automatically by Zuul, our gatekeeper,
and reviewed by other friendly developers. They will give you feedback and
may require you to refine it.

People seldom get their patch approved on the first try, so don't be
concerned if requested to make corrections. Feel free to modify your patch
and resubmit a new change-set.

Patches often take days (and sometimes weeks) to get reviewed, so be
patient. Don't hesitate to ask for help, and answer questions about your
work promptly if you can. The more you get to know reviewers and get to be
known by them, the smoother the review and approval process will become. The
fastest way to accomplish this is by reviewing other proposed changes
yourself: anybody can do it, and it's a great way to learn the code base.

Thanks again for participating in OpenDev, we look forward to seeing you
around.

Workflow Guide: https://docs.openstack.org/infra/manual/developers.html"}, {'account_id': 32288, 'date': '2020-08-10 15:23:30.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned'}]

commit_message:
Support changing the protocol part of callback_url to https

Adds a new kernel parameter for manual configuration and also creates
foundation for automatic TLS support later.

Change-Id: If341c3a8a268fc8cab6bd6be04b12ca32b31c8d8
Story: #2007214
Task: #40619

commit_message:
Add libvirt-devel installation

libvirt-python package is required by masakari-monitors, however it
can't be build without libvirt-devel.
Afterwards we should replace it with symlink from distro.

Without libvirt-devel installation of masakari-monitors fails [1]

[1] http://paste.openstack.org/show/767655/

Change-Id: I366e754bbc32f07bfc3166c119fec7141bd2e904
(cherry picked from commit a26ed9d5c4f666e8c754da278d39d54ea88909fa)

commit_message:
Revert "Apply cmd2 upper bound to python3"

Generally a good idea to not have upper caps on our dependencies.
Lets see if we can finally move forward with the newest cmd2 release.

This reverts commit af04e0c0292cbdd6db6159bbcf2723c9c9fd3b6a.

Change-Id: I2f22a640d14d7a1538532b14e43417d35c2cc515

commit_message:
[goal] Migrate testing to ubuntu focal

As per victoria cycle testing runtime and community goal[1]
we need to migrate upstream CI/CD to Ubuntu Focal(20.04).

Fixing:
- bug#1886298
Bump the lower constraints for required deps which added python3.8 support
in their later version.

Story: #2007865
Task: #40200

Closes-Bug: #1886298

[1] https://governance.openstack.org/tc/goals/selected/victoria/migrate-ci-cd-jobs-to-ubuntu-focal.h>

Change-Id: I6f0dc11d4eb7a75d29da3eb5071b156bbe46ad01

The mock third party library was needed for mock support in py2
runtimes. Since we now only support py36 and later, we can use the
standard lib unittest.mock module instead.

Change-Id: Ia3f2c8abc87cf5551d3469d616790e8e9d567bce
'}]
commit_message:
Use unittest.mock instead of mock

The mock third party library was needed for mock support in py2
runtimes. Since we now only support py36 and later, we can use the
standard lib unittest.mock module instead.

Change-Id: Ia3f2c8abc87cf5551d3469d616790e8e9d567bce

commit_message:
Remove the glusterfs connector code

We dropped support for glusterfs many releases ago. This cleans up the
os-brick code for its connector.

Change-Id: I9d74e639bae1742964558bd06dc8ca956ecf8fb7
Signed-off-by: Sean McGinnis <sean.mcginnis@gmail.com>

Add non-voting TripleO Octavia CI job

Job tripleo-ci-centos-8-scenario010-standalone tests a TripleO
deployment with Octavia enabled which heavily relies on puppet-octavia,
providing additional test coverage to the project.

commit_message:
Propose new Hardware Vendor SIG

This proposes the creation of a new SIG for those working on integration
with different hardware platforms. This is to enable collaboration and
open development for things like drivers, tooling, libraries, and any
other needs related to specific hardware support. The hope is this will
allow vendors to work together and share code and expertise to improve
overall hardware support.

Change-Id: If7f47e1cb12b27f5118dcd2d16464fac10463534
Signed-off-by: Sean McGinnis <sean.mcginnis@gmail.com>

[{'created': '2020-08-07 07:15:29.000000000', 'message': 'Set the OpenFlow protocol while upgrading OVS from 2.11

We noticed a bug in OSP that OVN controller (2.13) was unable to
contact to OVS bridge (2.11).
Before running the update we should set the OpenFlow protocols on
integration bridge (br-int).

More about the issue [1].

[1] https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1843811

Change-Id: I575d67521719ae3908777284b4225eff5169ae6b
(cherry picked from commit 29993d43b3a884fab35284fc2c56515400036e1f)
'}]
commit_message:
Set the OpenFlow protocol while upgrading OVS from 2.11

We noticed a bug in OSP that OVN controller (2.13) was unable to
contact to OVS bridge (2.11).
Before running the update we should set the OpenFlow protocols on
integration bridge (br-int).

More about the issue [1].

[1] https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1843811

Change-Id: I575d67521719ae3908777284b4225eff5169ae6b
(cherry picked from commit 29993d43b3a884fab35284fc2c56515400036e1f)

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-08-07 13:17:13.000000000', 'message': 'Fix Barbican client (Castellan) with TLS (part 2)

This patch is a continuation of
I6a174468bd91d214c08477b93c88032a45c137be for the nova-cell role, which
was missed.

The Castellan (Barbican client) has different parameters to control
the used CA file.
This patch uses them.
Moreover, this aligns Barbican with other services by defaulting
its client config to the internal endpoint.

See also [1].

[1] https://bugs.launchpad.net/castellan/+bug/1876102

Closes-Bug: #1886615

Change-Id: I056f3eebcf87bcbaaf89fdd0dc1f46d143db7785
'}]
commit_message:
Fix Barbican client (Castellan) with TLS (part 2)

This patch is a continuation of
I6a174468bd91d214c08477b93c88032a45c137be for the nova-cell role, which
was missed.

The Castellan (Barbican client) has different parameters to control
the used CA file.
This patch uses them.
Moreover, this aligns Barbican with other services by defaulting
its client config to the internal endpoint.

See also [1].

[1] https://bugs.launchpad.net/castellan/+bug/1876102

Closes-Bug: #1886615

Change-Id: I056f3eebcf87bcbaaf89fdd0dc1f46d143db7785

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-08-10 09:14:07.000000000', 'message': '[maintain-github-mirror] Skip abandoned gov files

Following the deletion of the foundation-board-repos.yaml file,
the script failed as it was expecting it.

Remove that file from the scanned list, and make the script more
resilient in case other extra files go missing in the future (like
user-committee.yaml which should soon be cleaned up).

Change-Id: I83cff14f19a829b5e56771442ffb3a0341e82d69
'}]
commit_message:
[maintain-github-mirror] Skip abandoned gov files

Following the deletion of the foundation-board-repos.yaml file,
the script failed as it was expecting it.

Remove that file from the scanned list, and make the script more
resilient in case other extra files go missing in the future (like
user-committee.yaml which should soon be cleaned up).

Change-Id: I83cff14f19a829b5e56771442ffb3a0341e82d69

commit_message:
Add --skip-ipa-cleanup to overcloud delete

The IPA cleanup bits may fail if the stack is in a bad state or IPA
wasn't used. We need to add the flag to allow a user to skip this
action.

Change-Id: Idf77ea052c783cfdbd74c8b6e4b3064c4b94b968

Adding ironic chassis_node_list test to skiplist.

ironic_tempest_plugin.tests.api.admin.test_chassis.TestChassis.test_chassis_node_list
test is failing while ironic tests run against tripleo.

Related-Bug: #1890424

Signed-off-by: Amol Kahat <amolkahat@gmail.com>

[{'created': '2020-08-10 09:13:22.000000000', 'message': 'Keep ceph-ansible 3 during whole FFU.

To be able to FFU a ceph-enabled environment, it is required to
keep installed in the system ceph-ansible 3 in the Undercloud until the

commit_message:
Keep ceph-ansible 3 during whole FFU.

To be able to FFU a ceph-enabled environment, it is required to
keep installed in the system ceph-ansible 3 in the Undercloud until the
converge step.

This patch adds the ceph-ansible package in the to_keep files, as well as
modifies some of the Undercloud upgrade tasks to make sure the package
survives to the leapp upgrade.

Co-Authored-By: Jesse Pretorius <jesse@odyssey4.me>
Change-Id: Ide724e398a5cd4fdaf77d1a127e9d5c32852ae6b
(cherry picked from commit d43cfabd5163c9c50aac21caccd3b4f6858cc72b)

commit_message:
Remove any python3 package before UC leapp.

The Tobiko package installas python3-devel which enters in
conflict during the leapp upgrade procedure. This change removes any
python3 package before running leapp.

Change-Id: Id7cca3e4f819c2dfdb3947c8c3522d98d03b5a86
(cherry picked from commit e121bd00cd2149da1ad77f14631e6b1125c8f735)
(cherry picked from commit 2ef35a298456874138445af46e9dafce010e15e6)

messages: [{'account_id': 11166, 'date': '2020-08-05 17:55:59.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Cherry Picked from branch master.'}, {'account_id': 26343, 'date': '2020-08-10 08:44:24.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2020-08-05 17:55:59.000000000', 'message': "Remove skip ceph-validations and --playbook for system_upgrade.

Now that the ceph-systemd validations are fixed, we don't need
to add all the skip ceph validations when running the ceph_systemd
step. Also, for [0] to take action, we need to run all playbooks
so the noout/nobalance params are executed in the
post_upgrades_steps_playbook.yaml. Therefore, the --playbook option
is removed from the system_upgrade step.

[0] - Ib10b6ad50e1052fe69640b39a173e856a426d607

Change-Id: I7c5b81545d56fabd021a306a549485e46a785241
"}]
commit_message:
Remove skip ceph-validations and --playbook for system_upgrade.

Now that the ceph-systemd validations are fixed, we don't need
to add all the skip ceph validations when running the ceph_systemd
step. Also, for [0] to take action, we need to run all playbooks
so the noout/nobalance params are executed in the
post_upgrades_steps_playbook.yaml. Therefore, the --playbook option
is removed from the system_upgrade step.

[0] - Ib10b6ad50e1052fe69640b39a173e856a426d607

Change-Id: I7c5b81545d56fabd021a306a549485e46a785241

commit_message:
Switch Standalone environment to centos8

Following changes are done with this patch:-
- Ussuri+ releases are CentOS8 only, switch the standalone
environment settings to reflect the same.
- Add some os tempest options in standalone environment
file to get tempest run with it.
- Enable repo setup on virthost it will be needed to get
repos needed by DLRN run.
- Add settings to not prepare overcloud nodes as standalone
deploy doesn't need those.
- Also add some vars required for standalone deployment.
- Do not use egg_info for tripleo-quickstart-extras path to
avoid quickstart-extras installation from pip cache and instead
install it from specified path.

This environment file will be used to test standalone
deployments on ci.centos.org.

Closes-Bug: #1889219
Depends-On: I87a0214a344a9b23dd267e412a37b2abe0eb0571
Change-Id: Ic17bf6e69b1620bdcca339f436e1399b29c0437e

[{'created': '2020-08-06 11:24:41.000000000', 'message': 'catch libvirt exception when nodedev not found.

This is a minimal fix to workaround instance where libvirt
retruns stale data due to internal caching. In some cases
libivrt can return stale data vai the nodedev api when the
mac adress of an interface such as an sriov virtual function
canages, i.e. when a mac adress is reset after a vm with
a virtual funciton is migrated.

Change-Id: Ic5e60c8e28263365fad5867e483b6ad55cee7281
Partial-Bug: #1883671
(cherry picked from commit af80c3ffd116837b296e79858595d42c893708a6)

'}]
commit_message:
catch libvirt exception when nodedev not found.

This is a minimal fix to workaround instance where libvirt
retruns stale data due to internal caching. In some cases
libivrt can return stale data vai the nodedev api when the
mac adress of an interface such as an sriov virtual function
canages, i.e. when a mac adress is reset after a vm with
a virtual funciton is migrated.

Change-Id: Ic5e60c8e28263365fad5867e483b6ad55cee7281
Partial-Bug: #1883671
(cherry picked from commit af80c3ffd116837b296e79858595d42c893708a6)
(cherry picked from commit 247e33af8fa1705b037e3343ec3b72a1b520c0c5)

commit_message:
Honour standalone updates too for container-prep

This is needed for running standalone deploy with
container updates outside of zuul. In zuul jobs issue
was not detected as update_containers is always
set for zuul jobs.

Partial-Bug: #1889219
Change-Id: I87a0214a344a9b23dd267e412a37b2abe0eb0571

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-07-02 09:00:02.000000000', 'message': "ubuntu: move to 20.04 Focal

There is a time once every 2 years when ubuntu team releases new LTS
release. And then UCA joins with binary packages for current OpenStack
development cycle.

commit_message:
ubuntu: move to 20.04 Focal

There is a time once every 2 years when ubuntu team releases new LTS
release. And then UCA joins with binary packages for current OpenStack
development cycle.

It is this time for Ubuntu 20.04 'focal'.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/745156
Change-Id: I045aa6b4b4fd83fbe7d1fda89549f0ef1e88ec12

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-08-08 18:14:27.000000000', 'message': 'Use TLS for json_rpc when configured

The configuration for json_rpc contains the option use_ssl but its value
was not respected by the json_rpc client. Therefore the client tried to
connect to HTTPS endpoints using HTTP.

Change-Id: I4336d71f57bcfbde90fa7b62a5435a7f9d0a73d3
(cherry picked from commit feae197c5ad02fa0898a30d4ffaaba8a21d4f884)
'}]
commit_message:
Use TLS for json_rpc when configured

The configuration for json_rpc contains the option use_ssl but its value
was not respected by the json_rpc client. Therefore the client tried to
connect to HTTPS endpoints using HTTP.

Change-Id: I4336d71f57bcfbde90fa7b62a5435a7f9d0a73d3
(cherry picked from commit feae197c5ad02fa0898a30d4ffaaba8a21d4f884)

commit_message:
Listen on :: by default

On most target systems it will make it available on both V4 and V6.

Change-Id: Ie918bc8572ff7f0ce2712cbb248e8ee9bf4c3d20

Testing completed on the zVM Driver CI system check-nova pipeline and failed.  To recheck only the zVM driver plugins, submit a comment with only  zvm: recheck in the comment.. Contact information: zvmosci@us.ibm.com. For information see https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/ZVMDriver.

- check-nova-master http://extbasicopstackcilog01.podc.sl.edst.ibm.com/test_logs/jenkins-check-nova-master-33098 : FAILURE in 3h 31m 09s'}, {'account_id': 10135, 'date': '2019-06-25 07:16:19.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

recheck infra'}, {'account_id': 8864, 'date': '2019-06-25 07:52:57.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1

The thing that bugs me is that before the original version of this patch merged, we would *always* wait in the virt driver for events, even for same host migration revert with OVS hybrid plug.

So I went looking for a passing neutron-tempest-iptables_hybrid from before the original version of this patch merged. I found one and traced the revertResize request (req-9bf9c2bb-5dc0-4e91-8f83-dbf7c3fa8d4a) [1].

We see it prepare to receive network-vif-plugged-6aa030df-732d-404c-8972-769c362f5f17 [2].

We then receive [3] and process [4] the event.

And finally we're done with finish_revert_migration [5].

So there's a plug-time event with same host OVS hybrid plug.

So the current version of this patch will introduce a regression where, because we no longer wait for any event at all for same host revert resize, we'll boot up instances with no networking. So I think we need to handle 3 cases:

  1. ovs normal multinode -> plug-time
  2. ovs normal same host -> plug-time
  3. ovs hybrid multinode -> bind-time
  4. ovs hybrid same host -> plug-time

1, 2 and 3 were handled by the original version. 4 is what caused the Neutron CI regression, and what we need to add in this version. As Sean said [6], plug-time events for same host is a problem because we don't have the Migration object in the driver. And really, it would make no sense to add a Migration object there.

Plug-time vs bind-time is a result of 2 inputs: the VIF type, and the migration "samehost-ness". So we'd need a helper function somewhere, that would accept the network_info (for the VIF part), and the migration, and would return what kind of events we expect.

[1] http://logs.openstack.org/22/665422/4/check/neutron-tempest-iptables_hybrid/ad4bc10/controller/logs/tempest_log.txt.gz#_2019-06-21_11_58_23_412
[2] http://logs.openstack.org/22/665422/4/check/neutron-tempest-iptables_hybrid/ad4bc10/controller/logs/screen-n-cpu.txt.gz#_Jun_21_11_58_31_174185
[3] http://logs.openstack.org/22/665422/4/check/neutron-tempest-iptables_hybrid/ad4bc10/controller/logs/screen-n-cpu.txt.gz#_Jun_21_11_58_38_290800
[4] http://logs.openstack.org/22/665422/4/check/neutron-tempest-iptables_hybrid/ad4bc10/controller/logs/screen-n-cpu.txt.gz#_Jun_21_11_58_38_292023
[5] http://logs.openstack.org/22/665422/4/check/neutron-tempest-iptables_hybrid/ad4bc10/controller/logs/screen-n-cpu.txt.gz#_Jun_21_11_58_38_312483
[6] https://review.opendev.org/#/c/667177/1/nova/virt/libvirt/driver.py@9138'}, {'account_id': 26515, 'date': '2019-06-25 09:39:36.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

Build succeeded.

- nova http://cloudbase-ci.com/nova/667177/2 : SUCCESS in 2h 22m 20s'}, {'account_id': 8864, 'date': '2019-07-01 06:12:09.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 8864, 'date': '2019-07-01 06:13:13.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-06-24 18:42:40.000000000', 'message': 'Revert resize: wait for events according to hybrid plug

Since 4817165fc5938a553fafa1a69c6086f9ebe311af, when reverting a
resized instance back to the source host, the libvirt driver waits for
vif-plugged events when spawning the instance. When called from
finish_revert_resize() in the source compute manager, libvirt's
finish_revert_migration() does not pass vifs_already_plugged to
_create_domain_and_network(), making the latter use the default False
value.

When the source compute manager calls
network_api.migrate_instance_finish() in finish_revert_resize(), this
updates the port binding back to the source host. If Neutron is
configured to use OVS hybrid plug, it will send the vif-plugged event
immediately after completing this request. This happens before the
virt driver's finish_revert_migration() method is called. This causes
the wait in the libvirt driver to time out because the event is
received before Nova starts waiting for it.

The neutron ovs l2 agent sends vif-plugged events when two conditions
are met. First the port must be bound to the host managed by the
l2 agent and second, the agent must have completed configuring the
port on ovs. This involves assigning the port a local VLAN for tenant
isolation, applying security group rules if required and applying
QoS policies or other agent extensions like service function chaining.

During the boot process, we bind the port first to the host
then plug the interface into ovs which triggers the l2 agent to
configure it resulting in the emission of the vif-plugged event.
In the revert case, as noted above, since the vif is already plugged
on the source node when hybrid-plug is used, binding the port to the
source node fulfils the second condition to send the vif-plugged event.

Events sent immediately after port binding update are hereafter known
as "bind-time" events. For ports that do not use OVS hybrid plug,
Neutron will continue to send vif-plugged events only when Nova
actually plugs the VIF. These types of events are hereafter known as
"plug-time" events. OVS hybrid plug is a per agent setting, so for
a particular host, bind-time events are an all-or-nothing thing for the
ovs backend: either all VIF_TYPE=ovs ports have them, or no ovs ports
have them. In general, a host will only have one network backend.
The only exception to this is SR-IOV. SR-IOV is commonly deployed on
the same host as other network backends such as OVS or linuxbridge.
SR-IOV ports with VNIC_TYPE=direct-physical will always have only
bind-time events. If an instance mixes OVS ports with hybrid-plug=False
with direct physical ports, it will have both kinds of events.

For same host resize reverts we do not update the binding host as the
host does not change, as such for same host resize we do not recive
bind time events. For same host revert we therefore do not wait for
bind time events in the compute manager.

This patch adds functions to the NetworkInfo model that return what
kinds of events each VIF has. These are then used in the migration
revert logic to decide when to wait for external events: in the
compute manager, when binding the port, for bind-time events,
and/or in libvirt, when plugging the VIFs, for plug-time events.

Change-Id: I51673e58fc8d5f051df911630f6d7a928d123a5b
Closes-bug: 1832028
Co-Authored-By: Sean Mooney <work@seanmooney.info>
Co-Authored-By: Artom Lifshitz <alifshit@redhat.com>

and/or in libvirt, when plugging the VIFs, for plug-time events.

Closes-bug: #1832028
Closes-Bug: #1833902
Co-Authored-By: Sean Mooney <work@seanmooney.info>
Co-Authored-By: Artom Lifshitz <alifshit@redhat.com>
Change-Id: I51673e58fc8d5f051df911630f6d7a928d123a5b
'}, {'created': '2019-07-01 11:06:00.000000000', 'message': 'Revert resize: wait for events according to hybrid plug

Since 4817165fc5938a553fafa1a69c6086f9ebe311af, when reverting a
resized instance back to the source host, the libvirt driver waits for
vif-plugged events when spawning the instance. When called from
finish_revert_resize() in the source compute manager, libvirt's
finish_revert_migration() does not pass vifs_already_plugged to
_create_domain_and_network(), making the latter use the default False
value.

When the source compute manager calls
network_api.migrate_instance_finish() in finish_revert_resize(), this
updates the port binding back to the source host. If Neutron is
configured to use OVS hybrid plug, it will send the vif-plugged event
immediately after completing this request. This happens before the
virt driver's finish_revert_migration() method is called. This causes
the wait in the libvirt driver to time out because the event is
received before Nova starts waiting for it.

The neutron ovs l2 agent sends vif-plugged events when two conditions
are met. First the port must be bound to the host managed by the
l2 agent and second, the agent must have completed configuring the
port on ovs. This involves assigning the port a local VLAN for tenant
isolation, applying security group rules if required and applying
QoS policies or other agent extensions like service function chaining.

During the boot process, we bind the port first to the host
then plug the interface into ovs which triggers the l2 agent to
configure it resulting in the emission of the vif-plugged event.
In the revert case, as noted above, since the vif is already plugged
on the source node when hybrid-plug is used, binding the port to the
source node fulfils the second condition to send the vif-plugged event.

Events sent immediately after port binding update are hereafter known
as "bind-time" events. For ports that do not use OVS hybrid plug,
Neutron will continue to send vif-plugged events only when Nova
actually plugs the VIF. These types of events are hereafter known as
"plug-time" events. OVS hybrid plug is a per agent setting, so for
a particular host, bind-time events are an all-or-nothing thing for the
ovs backend: either all VIF_TYPE=ovs ports have them, or no ovs ports
have them. In general, a host will only have one network backend.
The only exception to this is SR-IOV. SR-IOV is commonly deployed on
the same host as other network backends such as OVS or linuxbridge.
SR-IOV ports with VNIC_TYPE=direct-physical will always have only
bind-time events. If an instance mixes OVS ports with hybrid-plug=False
with direct physical ports, it will have both kinds of events.

For same host resize reverts we do not update the binding host as the
host does not change, as such for same host resize we do not receive
bind time events. For same host revert we therefore do not wait for
bind time events in the compute manager.

This patch adds functions to the NetworkInfo model that return what
kinds of events each VIF has. These are then used in the migration
revert logic to decide when to wait for external events: in the
compute manager, when binding the port, for bind-time events,
and/or in libvirt, when plugging the VIFs, for plug-time events.

Closes-bug: #1832028
Closes-Bug: #1833902
Co-Authored-By: Sean Mooney <work@seanmooney.info>
Co-Authored-By: Artom Lifshitz <alifshit@redhat.com>
Change-Id: I51673e58fc8d5f051df911630f6d7a928d123a5b

commit_message:
Revert resize: wait for events according to hybrid plug

Since 4817165fc5938a553fafa1a69c6086f9ebe311af, when reverting a
resized instance back to the source host, the libvirt driver waits for
vif-plugged events when spawning the instance. When called from
finish_revert_resize() in the source compute manager, libvirt's
finish_revert_migration() does not pass vifs_already_plugged to
_create_domain_and_network(), making the latter use the default False
value.

When the source compute manager calls
network_api.migrate_instance_finish() in finish_revert_resize(), this
updates the port binding back to the source host. If Neutron is
configured to use OVS hybrid plug, it will send the vif-plugged event
immediately after completing this request. This happens before the
virt driver's finish_revert_migration() method is called. This causes
the wait in the libvirt driver to time out because the event is
received before Nova starts waiting for it.

The neutron ovs l2 agent sends vif-plugged events when two conditions
are met. First the port must be bound to the host managed by the
l2 agent and second, the agent must have completed configuring the
port on ovs. This involves assigning the port a local VLAN for tenant
isolation, applying security group rules if required and applying
QoS policies or other agent extensions like service function chaining.

During the boot process, we bind the port first to the host
then plug the interface into ovs which triggers the l2 agent to
configure it resulting in the emission of the vif-plugged event.
In the revert case, as noted above, since the vif is already plugged
on the source node when hybrid-plug is used, binding the port to the
source node fulfils the second condition to send the vif-plugged event.

Events sent immediately after port binding update are hereafter known
as "bind-time" events. For ports that do not use OVS hybrid plug,
Neutron will continue to send vif-plugged events only when Nova
actually plugs the VIF. These types of events are hereafter known as
"plug-time" events. OVS hybrid plug is a per agent setting, so for
a particular host, bind-time events are an all-or-nothing thing for the
ovs backend: either all VIF_TYPE=ovs ports have them, or no ovs ports
have them. In general, a host will only have one network backend.
The only exception to this is SR-IOV. SR-IOV is commonly deployed on
the same host as other network backends such as OVS or linuxbridge.
SR-IOV ports with VNIC_TYPE=direct-physical will always have only
bind-time events. If an instance mixes OVS ports with hybrid-plug=False
with direct physical ports, it will have both kinds of events.

For same host resize reverts we do not update the binding host as the
host does not change, as such for same host resize we do not receive
bind time events. For same host revert we therefore do not wait for
bind time events in the compute manager.

This patch adds functions to the NetworkInfo model that return what
kinds of events each VIF has. These are then used in the migration
revert logic to decide when to wait for external events: in the
compute manager, when binding the port, for bind-time events,
and/or in libvirt, when plugging the VIFs, for plug-time events.

Closes-bug: #1832028
Closes-Bug: #1833902
Co-Authored-By: Sean Mooney <work@seanmooney.info>
Change-Id: I51673e58fc8d5f051df911630f6d7a928d123a5b

commit_message:
Keep ceph-ansible 3 during whole FFU.

To be able to FFU a ceph-enabled environment, it is required to
keep installed in the system ceph-ansible 3 in the Undercloud until the
converge step.

This patch adds the ceph-ansible package in the to_keep files, as well as
modifies some of the Undercloud upgrade tasks to make sure the package
survives to the leapp upgrade.

Co-Authored-By: Jesse Pretorius <jesse@odyssey4.me>
Change-Id: Ide724e398a5cd4fdaf77d1a127e9d5c32852ae6b
